text: The modern Republic of India (Hindi: ); has several official National symbols including a historical document, a flag, an emblem, an anthem, a memorial tower, as well as several national heroes, etc. All the symbols were picked up at various times. The design of the national flag was officially adopted by the Constituent Assembly just 21 days before Independence, on the 24th of July in 1947. There are also several other patriotic symbols including the national mammal, bird, fruit, flower, tree, etc. These have all been selected carefully to project the image of to reflect Indian culture and beliefs and also the positive tributes often associated with Indian traditions respectively. ==Other Indian National and Official symbols== Symbol Name Image References National personification Bharatmata Bharat Mata's third temple will be built in Kurukshetra, 5 acres of land will be near Jyotisar National flag Flag of India National emblem Coat of Arms of India National motto Satyameva Jayate Father of the Nation Mohandas Karamchand Gandhi Mother of the Nation Sarojini Naidu National patron saint Sai Baba of Shirdi National hero Bal Gangadhar Tilak What is Swaraj? .
